■Food rotation follows the 
"first-in, first-out" rule.
(New food is stored behind older
food).

■When taking out raw food, check
the shelf life and use the ones
with the oldest non-expired date
first.

■Arranging raw food incorrectly
can cause older food to expire
before it can be used, wasting
it unnecessarily and affecting
store costs.

■Check the quality of raw food
items and discard any that do
not meet quality standards.
■Each store has rules for
storing raw food. Therefore,
consult with your manager first.
